data.chText: （尤指厌烦或紧张地）不断摸弄，不停摆弄
data.enText: to keep touching or moving sth with your hands, especially because you are bored or nervous

data.chText: 和我谈话时他不停地摆弄钥匙。
data.enText: He was fiddling with his keys while he talked to me.
to change the details or figures of sth in order to try to get money dishonestly, or gain an advantage
to fiddle the accounts

data.chText: 她当会计时对账簿做了手脚。
data.enText: She fiddled the books (= changed a company's financial records) while working as an accountant.
to play music on the violin
fiddle about/around
to spend your time doing things that are not important
fiddle about/around with sth
fiddle with sth

data.chText: 不断摆弄；不停对…作小修小改
data.enText: to keep touching sth or making small changes to sth because you are not satisfied with it

data.chText: 我不断地修改这个设计已经好长时间了。
data.enText: I've been fiddling about with this design for ages.

data.chText: 拨弄，摆弄（为改变或修理某物）
data.enText: to touch or move the parts of sth in order to try to change it or repair it
Who's been fiddling with the TV again?
something that is done dishonestly to get money
an insurance/tax, etc. fiddle
an act of moving sth or adjusting sth in order to make it work
something that is difficult to do
be on the fiddle
to be doing sth dishonest to get money
play second fiddle (to sb/sth)

data.chText: 当第二把手；居次要地位；当副手
data.enText: to be treated as less important than sb/sth; to have a less important position than sb/sth else

means: (尤指厌烦或紧张地)不断摸弄

data.enText: be on the fiddle
to be doing sth dishonest to get money
play second fiddle (to sb/sth)

data.chText: 当第二把手；居次要地位；当副手
data.enText: to be treated as less important than sb/sth; to have a less important position than sb/sth else
(as) fit as a fiddle
in very good physical condition
fiddle about/around
to spend your time doing things that are not important
fiddle about/around with sth
fiddle with sth

data.chText: 不断摆弄；不停对…作小修小改
data.enText: to keep touching sth or making small changes to sth because you are not satisfied with it

data.chText: 我不断地修改这个设计已经好长时间了。
data.enText: I've been fiddling about with this design for ages.

data.chText: 拨弄，摆弄（为改变或修理某物）
data.enText: to touch or move the parts of sth in order to try to change it or repair it
Who's been fiddling with the TV again?

trans: 鼓捣，摆弄（机器，使其运转）

tr: bowed stringed instrument that is the highest member of the violin family
this instrument has four strings and a hollow body and an unfretted fingerboard and is played with a bow

example: Can you tinker with the T.V. set--it's not working right
She always fiddles with her van on the weekend

tr: play around with or alter or falsify, usually secretively or dishonestly
example: Someone tampered with the documents on my desk
The reporter fiddle with the facts

tr: manipulate manually or in one's mind or imagination
example: She played nervously with her wedding ring
He played with the idea of running for the Senate
Zuckerman fiddled that song very nicely

tr: commit fraud and steal from one's employer
example: We found out that she had been fiddling for years
The derelict soldier shirked his duties

value.def: If you fiddle with an object, you keep moving it or touching it with your fingers.

example.ex: Harriet fiddled with a pen on the desk.
example.tran: 哈丽雅特摆弄着桌上的钢笔。

value.def: If you fiddle with something, you change it in minor ways.

example.ex: She told Whistler that his portrait of her was finished and to stop fiddling with it.
example.tran: 她告诉惠斯勒他给她画的肖像已经完成，不要再改了。

value.tran: 作小改动;略微变动;稍稍修改

value.def: If you fiddle with a machine, you adjust it.

example.ex: He turned on the radio and fiddled with the knob until he got a talk show.
example.tran: 他打开收音机，拨动旋钮，直至调到一个脱口秀节目。

value.def: If someone fiddles financial documents, they alter them dishonestly so that they get money for themselves.

example.tran: 不要再在开支账户上动手脚了。

value.def: A fiddle is a dishonest action or scheme in which someone gets money for themselves.

example.ex: Police investigating a £10 million car insurance fiddle arrested 16 people yesterday.
example.tran: 调查涉及 1,000 万英镑的汽车保险诈骗案的警察昨天逮捕了 16 人。

example.ex: ...legitimate businesses that act as covers for tax fiddles.
example.tran: 为骗税打掩护的合法企业

value.def: If something is a fiddle, it is quite difficult to do because it involves small or complicated objects.

example.ex: I found out how to fix the tray on — a bit of a fiddle.
example.tran: 我知道该怎么把这盘子固定住了——有点麻烦。

value.def: Some people call violins fiddles, especially when they are used to play folk music.

example.ex: Hardy as a young man played the fiddle at local dances.
example.tran: 哈迪年轻时在当地舞会上演奏小提琴。

value.tran: (尤指用于演奏民间音乐的)小提琴

value.def: Someone who is as fit as a fiddle is very healthy and full of energy.

example.ex: I'm as fit as a fiddle — with energy to spare.

value.def: If someone is on the fiddle, they get money by doing illegal or dishonest things.

If you say that someone is fiddling while Rome burns, you mean that they are not dealing with a difficult or dangerous situation but instead are doing useless things or pretending that nothing is wrong.
value.tran: 大难临头仍歌舞升平;见危难而若无其事

value.def: If you play second fiddle to someone, your position is less important than theirs in something that you are doing together.

example.ex: She hated the thought of playing second fiddle to Rose.
example.tran: 想到要身居罗斯之下她就很郁闷。

value.tran: 处于次要地位;当副手;唱配角

value.def: If you fiddle around or fiddle about with a machine, you do things to it to try and make it work.

example.ex: Two of them got out to fiddle around with the engine.
example.tran: 其中两人下车鼓捣引擎。

value.def: If someone fiddles around or fiddles about, they waste time doing unimportant things instead of dealing with important problems.

example.ex: He wants lawmakers to basically stop fiddling around as the country moves closer to breaking up...
example.tran: 国家在日益走向分裂，他希望立法者们再不要无所事事了。

example.ex: He wastes time fiddling about with minor matters.
example.tran: 他把时间都浪费在鸡毛蒜皮的小事上。

value.tran: 虚度光阴;无所事事;瞎混

value.def: If you say that someone is fiddling around with or fiddling about with something, you mean that they are changing it in a way that you disapprove of.

example.ex: Right now in Congress, they're fiddling around with the budget and so on...
example.tran: 此时在国会，他们正就预算案等等瞎折腾。

example.ex: One always wonders when a man starts fiddling about with his Will.
example.tran: 一个人开始把遗嘱改来改去时总让人感到诧异。

trans: 鼓捣，摆弄（机器，使其运转）
